text: Lester and Norma Dent House, also known as the House of Gadgets, is a historic home located at La Plata, Macon County, Missouri. It was built in 1941, and is a 1 1/2-story, Modern Movement style dwelling sheathed in brick and asbestos siding. The house has a gable roof and is of the Cape Cod cottage type. It was the home of American pulp-fiction author Lester Dent (1904-1959). (includes 14 photographs from 1989) It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1990. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Modernist architecture in Missouri Category:Houses completed in 1941 Category:Houses in Macon County, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Macon County, Missouri
title: Lester and Norma Dent House
